result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Richard Fleischauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Francis Collins  DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Brian Richard Fleischauer appeared from jail. Case called at 1:05 p.m. Court reviews file. Defendant did not check into probation. ADA Collins states defendant is enrolled in Washington Co. Probation and did not check into local probation. Agent Gaffney from Washington Co. Currently sitting on PO Hold. Agent Engel from St Croix Co. No other holds or warrants. Requesting discharge on warrants. Atty Harrelson in agreement to recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Ride needed to return to MN.  Court at this time QUASHES WARRANT and will table the other matters for a different day.

CO: RMW; REP: Drost; CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Francis D. Collins   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Brian Richard Fleischauer appeared. Case called at 9:54 a.m. ADA Collins files an amended information with the court and gives recommendations to the agreement. No request for restitution and stolen property was returned. Atty Harrelson is in agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Misdemeanor Ct's 1 and 2 in 14CF394 per the charges in the amended information. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts filed in the amended information. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 and Ct 2 in 14CF394, BOTH CHARGES AMENDED TO MISDEMEANOR. ADA Collins would like court to Voir Dire with the defendant of understanding of the repeater charge on the counts and the potential penalties. Court goes over increased penalties with the defendant. Atty Harrelson states defendant is currently on probation in MN in both Scott and Washington Co. Did serve some jail time on this case. Number of days not known at this time.  Sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statement. Bond continues until check in at probation. Crt orders:

-  S/W  2 years probation. Report to probation by 4 p.m. today.

- Follow all rules and  recommendations by probation agent

- Misd. Court Costs on both counts. Set up a payment plan

CO: TCH for Cameron, RPR: Tape, Clerk: Benoy  8:52    ADA: Matthew L Hartung,  DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF:  Brian Richard Fleischauer appeared from jail. Court confirms address for DE.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. DE enters NG plea.  Reserves speedy trial.
Pre-trial conference on April 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Wal-Mart, Hudson WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Ct Commissioner Heckmann for HWC. Rep: Erin Drost. Clerk: Liddle. ADA:   Kevin Gehler   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Brian Richard Fleischauer appeared from jail. Case called at 3:33 p.m. ADA Gehler calls Officer Kate Potter to the stand. S/T Officer Potter. Employed by Hudson PD. ADA Gehler directs. Officer Potter identifies defendant in the courtroom. Atty Harrelson cross directs. ADA Gehler redirects. Officer excused at 3:42 p.m. ADA Gehler, no other witnesses. Makes argument that burden of proof met and asks for bind over. Atty Harrelson gives argument. Court finds that state has proven plausible cause for felony and bind defendant over for trial. Bond to continue in form and amount. Atty Harrelson argues bond. ADA Gehler makes argument. Court orders that bond will continue in current form and amount. Court adjourned at 3:49 p.m. hml  Arraignment scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:45 am.
Per SRN 2/12/15 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Wal Mart in Hudson WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
